intro: Antirrhinum subalpinum, commonly known as the alpine snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing vibrant red or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and grasslands. Antirrhinum subalpinum is adapted to cold climates and is a hardy species that can withstand harsh mountain conditions.
